prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Create the coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.45, 0.0] Create the 2D sketch 1. On the XY plane of the new coordinate system, draw a rectangle with the following dimensions: * Point 1: (0.0, 0.0) * Point 2: (0.75, 0.0) * Point 3: (0.75, 0.045) * Point 4: (0.0, 0.045) Scale the 2D sketch Scale the rectangle by 75% (0.75) in all directions. Transform the 2D sketch to 3D Sketch Transform the scaled rectangle into a 3D Sketch using the rotation and translation parameters previously defined for the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D model Extrude the 3D Sketch with the following parameters: * Extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.45 units * Extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 units * Sketch_scale: 0.75 * Use "NewBodyFeatureOperation" for boolean operation The resulting shape for `part_1` is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, parallel sides, and perpendicular faces with these dimensions: * Length: 0.75 units * Width: 0.45 units * Height: 0.75 units Part 2 Instructions Create the coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.45, 0.45, 0.0] Create the 2D sketch 1. On the XY plane of this coordinate system, draw a square with the following dimensions: * Point 1: (0.0, 0.0) * Point 2: (0.045, 0.0) * Point 3: (0.045, 0.045) * Point 4: (0.0, 0.045) Scale the 2D sketch Scale the square by 45% in both directions. Create the cylindrical hole Draw a circle at the center with a radius of (circle radius = 0.045 / 2 = 0.0225) and delete this circle to create the cylindrical hole. Transform the 2D sketch to 3D Sketch Transform the modified 2D Sketch into a 3D Sketch using the rotation and translation parameters previously defined for the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D model Extrude the 3D Sketch with the following parameters: * Extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.0675 units (height of the prism) * Extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 units * Sketch_scale: 0.045 (corresponding to prism's width) * Use "CutFeatureOperation" for boolean operation The resulting shape for `part_2` is a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center with these dimensions: * Length: 0.045 units * Width: 0.0675 units * Height: 0.045 units Part 3 Instructions Create the coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.105, 0.45, 0.0] Follow the same process as for Parts 1 and 2 to create a 3D model. Remember that since Part 3 is a direct replica of Part 2, you only need to transform the coordinate system. The resulting shape for `part_3` is a six-sided prism with a cylindrical hole in the center and these dimensions: * Length: 0.045 units * Width: 0.0675 units * Height: 0.045 units Finally, you can join `part_1` and `part_3` together, and perform another "CutFeatureOperation" for `part_2` to obtain the final shape.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.45,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.045]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.045],"End Point":[0.0,0.045]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.045],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.45,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.45,0.45,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.045,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.045,0.0],"End Point":[0.045,0.045]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.045,0.045],"End Point":[0.0,0.045]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.045],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0675,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.045,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}},"part_3":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.105,0.45,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.045,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.045,0.0],"End Point":[0.045,0.045]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.045,0.045],"End Point":[0.0,0.045]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.045],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0675,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.045,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}}}}

prompt: <description>Part 1: Creating a Rectangular Prism with a Circular Hole Step 1: Setting up the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: 1. Set the Euler Angles to (0, 0, -90) 2. Set the Translation Vector to (0.0, 0.3368, 0.0) Step 2: Drawing the 2D Sketch With the new coordinate system set up, proceed to draw the 2D sketch for the first face of the prism. 1. Create a rectangle with the following vertices: - Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.75, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.505) - Line 3: Start Point (0.75, 0.505), End Point (0.0, 0.505) - Line 4: Start Point (0.0, 0.505), End Point (0.0, 0.0) The rectangle is a face with a single loop and four lines. Step 3: Extruding the 2D Sketch to a 3D Model With the 2D sketch complete, extrude it to create a 3D model. 1. Set the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0.3368 2. Set the extrusion depth opposite the normal to 0.0 3. Adjust the sketch scale to 0.75 4. Select the New Body Feature Operation for the extrusion For the description, the shape is a rectangular prism with a circular hole in the center, the length is approximately 0.75, the width is approximately 0.3367, and the height is approximately 0.3368. Part 2: Cutting a Portion Out of the First Prism to Create a Sloped Side Step 1: Setting up the Coordinate System For the second part, start by creating a new coordinate system with the same Euler Angles as the first, but different translation. 1. Set the Euler Angles to (0, 0, -90) 2. Set the Translation Vector to (0.0616, 0.0, 0.037) Step 2: Drawing the 2D Sketch With the new coordinate system set up, proceed to draw the 2D sketch that will replace the existing volume with the sloped side. 1. Create a rectangle with the following vertices: - Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.6323, 0.0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.6323, 0.0), End Point (0.6323, 0.4284) - Line 3: Start Point (0.6323, 0.4284), End Point (0.0, 0.4284) - Line 4: Start Point (0.0, 0.4284), End Point (0.0, 0.0) The rectangle is a face with a single loop and four lines. Step 3: Extruding the 2D Sketch to a 3D Model With the 2D sketch complete, extrude it to modify the existing 3D model. 1. Set the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0.0 2. Set the extrusion depth opposite the normal to 0.3334 3. Adjust the sketch scale to 0.6323 4. Select the Cut Feature Operation for the extrusion For the description, the shape is still a rectangular prism with a circular hole in the center, the length is approximately 0.6323, the width is approximately 0.3334, and the height is approximately 0.6323. The sloped side is the result of a cut made into the first prism's volume.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly angled front face. Creating the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.375, 0.0] Creating the 2D sketch for the rectangular prism 1. Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. 2. Draw the first line (line\\_1) on the sketch, starting at the origin and ending at `(0.6, 0)`. 3. Draw the second line (line\\_2) on the sketch, starting at `(0.6, 0)` and ending at `(0.6, 0.75)`. 4. Draw the third line (line\\_3) on the sketch, starting at `(0.6, 0.75)` and ending at `(0, 0.75)`. 5. Draw the fourth line (line\\_4) on the sketch, starting at `(0, 0.75)` and ending at the origin (0,0). Extruding the 2D sketch into a 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis based on the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards normal (Z-axis): 0.375 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Sketch Scale: 0.75 Part 2: Carve a rectangular section from the previously constructed prism Creating the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system based on the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.6, 0.0, 0.075] Creating the 2D sketch for the carving 1. Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. 2. Draw the first line (line\\_1) on the sketch, starting at the origin (0,0) and ending at `(0.225, 0)`. 3. Draw the second line (line\\_2) on the sketch, starting at `(0.225, 0)` and ending at `(0.225, 0.675)`. 4. Draw the third line (line\\_3) on the sketch, starting at `(0.225, 0.675)` and ending at `(0, 0.675)`. 5. Draw the fourth line (line\\_4) on the sketch, starting at `(0, 0.675)` and ending at the origin (0,0). Subtracting the carved section from the original prism Perform a cut on the previously created prism with the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards normal (Z-axis): 0.0 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.6 - Sketch Scale: 0.675 Here is a summary of the parts and their respective dimensions: - Part 1: a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, dimensions of `(0.75 × 0.375 × 0.75)`. - Part 2: a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom with dimensions of `(0.6 × 0.675 × 0.675)`. - Final shape: a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly angled front face, dimensions `(width ≈ 2, height ≈ 3, depth ≈ 1.5)`.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered shape, narrowing slightly towards the bottom. The top and bottom edges are sharp and straight. The object is centered in the image. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with no rotation (Euler Angles: 0, 0, 0) and no translation (Translation Vector: 0, 0, 0). For the sketch, create a circle (Center: 0.375, 0.375, Radius: 0.375) on face 1 as follows: 1. Draw a line from (0, 0) to (0.75, 0). 2. Draw a line from (0, 0) to (0, 0.75). 3. Connect the endpoints to form a right angle. 4. Draw a circle centered at the intersection with a radius of 0.375. Scale the sketch by 0.75. Extrude the sketch with a depth of 0.0103 towards the normal and no opposite normal depth. Apply the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" operation. Part 2 Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly curved side. It is also slightly tilted to the right. Create a new coordinate system at (0.0793, 0.1508, 0.0103) with no rotation (Euler Angles: 0, 0, 0). For the sketch, create a circle (Center: 0.2611, 0.2611, Radius: 0.2611) on face 1 as follows: 1. Draw a line from (0, 0) to (0.5222, 0). 2. Draw a line from (0, 0) to (0, 0.5222). 3. Connect the endpoints to form a right angle. 4. Draw a circle centered at the intersection with a radius of 0.2611. Scale the sketch by 0.5222. Extrude the sketch with a depth of 0.0103 towards the normal and no opposite normal depth. Apply the "JoinFeatureOperation" operation. Part 3 Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, slightly tapered towards the bottom, and a smooth surface. Create a new coordinate system at (0.1055, 0.1871, 0.0206) with no rotation (Euler Angles: 0, 0, 0). For the sketch, create a circle (Center: 0.238, 0.238, Radius: 0.238) on face 1 as follows: 1. Draw a line from (0, 0) to (0.4759, 0). 2. Draw a line from (0, 0) to (0, 0.4759). 3. Connect the endpoints to form a right angle. 4. Draw a circle centered at the intersection with a radius of 0.238. Scale the sketch by 0.4759. Extrude the sketch with a depth of 0.0103 towards the normal and no opposite normal depth. Apply the "JoinFeatureOperation" operation. Upon completion, you should have the final shape consisting of the three joined parts as mentioned in the JSON.</description>
